CatDescriptText: Curtis Bodison, 101 Boggston Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 1, 1958 pg 4 with question: "Should parents compel children who are still students in high school or college to work to help support the family?" answer reads: "I think he should if work is available. For one thing, the parents have been able to help him along that far and if the job opportunity presents itself, while the child is in school, he should help his parents."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Curtis Bodison wearing fedora and moustache, holding pipe in mouth, standing in front of block and brick building
